DOC.brief_title: Preventing Adolescents From Entering Juvenile Justice System
DOC.detailed_description: This study propose rigorously test innovative Civil Citation Program ( CCP ) integrate evidence-based family intervention , Multidimensional Family Therapy [ MDFT ] ( Liddle , 2002 ) . The study sample include youth refer CCP throughout Miami-Dade county accord CCP screening rat high risk re-offending . Youth 12-17 year old first second misdemeanor charge ( exclude gang , violence , sex crime charge ) . Nearly ( 97 % ) youth ethnic minority ( Hispanic African American ) . They risk school failure , substance use , chronic delinquency due drug availability community , poor family functioning , peer drug use/delinquency , school failure / disengagement . 120 youth enter Civil Citation Program eligible study assign one two intervention : CCP+SAU experimental intervention , CCP+MDFT . The study ask classical service research question ( Compton et al , 2005 ) - addition family therapy intervention , multidimensional family therapy , exist diversion program significantly enhance program outcome key outcome domain : recidivism , substance use , delinquency , school family functioning .
